page.title: 01The Greatworth Area
page.content: The land is of an undulating nature much affected by agriculture. The main centres of population are the villages of Marston St. Lawrence approx. 200 persons and Greatworth approx. 1000 persons. The armed forces built an RAF radio station at Greatworth in 1941 and some of the population of this village is made up of service personnel. Childrens education is at Greatworth Primary School which serves both communities along with the one village shop. The area is visited by a number of mobile traders. There are two churches in Greatworth, St. Peters and the Methodist. Marston is served by the church of St. Lawrence Marston.Each community has a number of thriving clubs which reflect the interests of the population.
